page.title: 14STORETON HALL FARM
page.content: Storeton Hall Farm is one of four farms owned by a{family business,}the other three are in Chorley. It is managed by one of the sons. Between them they share nine tractors and two combine harvesters. On this farm they have one barn which is used for storing hay, and silage is produced from 45 acres of grass. Their main{crops}are winter wheat, winter barley, spring barley, peas, potatoes and oats. This year they are growing a variety of vegetables such as cabbages, sprouts, cauliflowers and broccoli. They employ 4 staff to work the farm. In the yard there is a{farm-shop which sells their vegetables. They have 450 beef cattle which are fattened up for 10-12 months and then sold. This year they are starting to produce sheep and poultry.
